intro: Monardella franciscana, commonly known as Franciscan monardella, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in rocky soils along the coastline, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
